oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rumen cannulation and utilization of a donor animal
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Laflin, Shelie L.
Gnad, David P.
Walz, Paul H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cannulae
cannulation
donors
postoperative care
rumen
rumen contents
rumen flora
rumen fluid
surgery
surgical operations
techniques
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Careful selection of a transfaunate donor animal will improve the outcome of rumen cannula placement and the longevity of the donor animal. A cannulated animal provides an easily accessible source of rumen fluid. Rumen cannulation can be done on an animal currently within the herd with minimal expense.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: The Bovine Practitioner; Vol. 38, No. 1 (2004 February); 54-58
